description: From Latin abscessus (“a going away; gathering of humors, abscess”), from abscēdō (“go away, depart”), from abs (“away from”) + cēdō (“go”). See cede.

entries.meaning: (pathology) A cavity caused by tissue destruction, usually because of infection, filled with pus and surrounded by inflamed tissue. [First attested in the mid 16th century.]

verbs.description: abscess (third-person singular simple present abscesses, present participle abscessing, simple past and past participle abscessed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To form a pus-filled cavity, typically from an infection.
